channel.title: Npc drop help?
channel.description: i tried to put pictures up but it didn't work so ill just try to explain it. first. i went to npcdrops.cfg i added one new npc because it wasn't in there. my npc is 2883(dagannoth Rex) and heres my code for my npcdrop. [tt]npcdrop = 2279 1 995 9000000[/tt] first number is my npc id. second number is drop type. 3rd number is item id(coins) and fourth is amount. and then i saved and compiled. i killed one and it drops an archers ring. so i got off and i put another dagannoth Rex and instead i changed the item id to 00995 like when you do ::pickup you have to put the zeros. i saved and compiled and got back on and it dropped a berserker ring. so i thought my item id's were mixed up so i opened it up and it said 995= coins and archers ring= 6733 and berserker ring = 6737 so what is wrong? my compiler says there is no errors either.

item.title: Npc drop help?
item.dc:creator: @SirPali SirPali
item.description:
@SirPali wrote:

Check your Item2.java
There is probably a method in there that chooses a random drop from a bunch of drops.

To find out what method, check your NpcHandler.java and search for the id of good ol’ Rexie (2279).

Read full topic

item.title: Npc drop help?
item.dc:creator: @lover854 lover854
item.description:
@lover854 wrote:

Your Code

npcdrop = 2279      1      995   9000000

New Code (change to this)

npcdrop = 2279      995      9000000      1

Change the spaces from the numbers with tabs else u get run error hope i helpde

Read full topic

item.title: Npc drop help?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

[quote=“kicker862, post:1, topic:330240”]i tried to put pictures up but it didn’t work so ill just try to explain it.
first.
i went to npcdrops.cfg
i added one new npc because it wasn’t in there.
my npc is 2883(dagannoth Rex)
and heres my code for my npcdrop.
[tt]npcdrop = 2279 1 995 9000000[/tt]
first number is my npc id. second number is drop type. 3rd number is item id(coins) and fourth is amount.
and then i saved and compiled. i killed one and it drops an archers ring. so i got off and i put another dagannoth Rex and instead i changed the item id to 00995 like when you do ::pickup you have to put the zeros.
i saved and compiled and got back on and it dropped a berserker ring.
so i thought my item id’s were mixed up so i opened it up and it said 995= coins and archers ring= 6733 and berserker ring = 6737
so what is wrong?
my compiler says there is no errors either.[/quote]

A compiler is for Java Source Files(.java), Not Configuration Files(.cfg) It wouldn’t show errors because you don’t compile them.

Read full topic
